RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui Graduao, Mestrado, Doutorado e Pos Doutorado em Qumica pela Universidade Estadual Paulista Jlio de Mesquita Filho (Unesp - IQ Araraquara). Atualmente realiza ps doutorado na Universidade Politecnica de Torino na Italia. Atuou na rea de pesquisa e desenvolvimento na 3M do Brasil com foco em produtos para o mercado eletro eletrnico. Possui experincia na rea de pesquisa atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: sensor, biosensor, nanomateriais, sntese qumica, filmes finos, materiais cermicos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: It has undergraduate, Masters and PhD in Chemistry from the Universidade Estadual Paulista Julio de Mesquita Filho (UNESP - Araraquara IQ). Currently carrying out post doctorate in chemistry from Unesp. He worked in research and development area in 3M Brazil focusing on products for electronic electro market. You have experience in research mainly working on the following topics: sensor, biosensor, nanomaterials, chemical synthesis, thin films, ceramic materials.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: O estgio foi realizado na rea de aplicao e produto da linha de Titulao, tendo como objetivo conhecer a linha de equipamentos para Titulao Potenciomtrica, Titulao Karl Fischer, Medidores de ons e pH metros bem como a tcnica utilizada. Desenvolvemos tambm novas metodologias de anlise para diversos segmentos da industria qumica.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universidade Estadual Paulista Jlio de Mesquita Filho

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Sntese e caracterizao de filmes finos e nanoestruturas de BiFeO3 modificado com Sm visando aplicao em memrias de mltiplos estados.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O desenvolvimento de materiais nanoestruturados tem despertado grande interesse das indstrias de componentes microeletrnicos, uma vez que estes possibilitam o desenvolvimento de dispositivos de memrias de mltiplos estados, sensores e aplicaes no emergente campo da spintrnica. Estes dispositivos so empregados em ?notebooks?, circuitos integrados, telefones celulares e a moderna tecnologia ?Bluetooth? devido s suas excelentes propriedades ferroeltricas, como no volatilidade e a baixa voltagem de operao. Numa recente anlise da literatura, verificou-se a inexistncia de trabalhos a partir de soluo orgnica de citratos que descrevem o processo de preparao e caracterizao de materiais com estrutura BiFeO3 na forma de filmes para aplicaes como componente ferroeltrico em circuitos integrados. Desta forma, este projeto tem como objetivo estudar a formao de filmes finos texturizados de BiFeO3 puro e dopado com smario em baixas temperaturas, bem como avaliar o efeito da disposio e orientao dos domnios ferroeltricos, visando obter filmes com propriedades compatveis para uso em memrias ferroeltricas e dispositivos piezoeltricos. Para isso, os filmes finos sero depositados em substratos adequados controlando-se a homogeneidade qumica, a microestrutura e a interao filme-eletrodo. Pretende-se sintetizar nanoestruturas de ferrita de bismuto a partir do mtodo de ?template-directed? via tratamento hidrotermal e hidrotermal assistido por microondas usando diferentes surfactantes, visando obteno de nanofios e nanofitas. Combinando-se experimentos de laboratrio e clculos tericos deseja-se entender a organizao das nanopartculas e sua estrutura resultante.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Sntese e caracterizao de filmes finos e nanoestruturas de BiFeO3 modificado com Sm visando aplicao em memrias de mltiplos estados.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Qumica Araraquara - Departamento de Bioquimica e Tecnologia

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Preparao e caracterizao de filmes finos de CaBi4Ti4O15 e SrBi4Ti4O15 a partir de precursores polimricos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este trabalho teve como objetivo a obter filmes finos de CaBi4Ti4O15 e SrBi4Ti4O15 com estequiometria bem controlada e alta cristalinidade a partir do mtodo dos precursores polimricos, bem como otimizar as condies de deposio da soluo de CaBi4Ti4O15 e SrBi4Ti4O15, utilizando os mtodos ?dip e spin-coating?. E co-relacionar a estrutura e microestrutura desenvolvida com a viscosidade, concentrao inica das solues, rota de cristalizao, temperatura e atmosfera de tratamento trmico.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Preparao e caracterizao de filmes finos de CaBi4Ti4O15 e SrBi4Ti4O15 a partir de precursores polimricos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Biossensores de xido de grafeno e nanopartculas de ouro para deteco de doenas infectocontagiosas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Os recentes avanos nas pesquisas interdisciplinares em diagnstico molecular tem levado um rpido desenvolvimento de diferentes classes de biossensores com caractersticas sensoras cada vez melhores. Alm disso, o desenvolvimento nas reas de engenharia e nanotecnologia tem sido de fundamental importncia para miniaturizao e multifuncionalidade tecnolgica dos biossensores. Os custos da indstria de sade no mundo vm aumentando consideravelmente nos ltimos anos devido ao envelhecimento da populao associado ao aumento da conscincia sobre a sade o que gera uma maior necessidade de assistncia mdica peridica. Alm disso, no Brasil os tratamentos das doenas ocorrem de na maioria dos casos de forma reativa, quando a doena diagnosticada j est em estgio avanada. O diagnstico molecular facilita a deteco primria das doenas com maior especificidade e sensibilidade, porm demandam tempo e so de alto custo. Os biossensores tm surgido como uma alternativa barata, de fcil manuseio, porttil e com alta sensibilidade e especificidade. Dentro desse contexto, a presente proposta objetiva estudar nanopartculas de xido de grafeno/Au crescidos via sntese qumica e depositados em diferentes tipos de substratos visando aplicaes de grande interesse tecnolgico como os biossensores. Os materiais sintetizados tero suas propriedades estruturais e morfolgicas caracterizadas por microscopia de fora atmica (AFM), microscopia eletrnica de varredura (MEV), difrao de raios-X (XRD) e microscopia eletrnica de transmisso (MET). O material utilizado ser o xido de grafeno reduzido (RGO) com nanopartculas de ouro (Au), devido s propriedades funcionais desse xido, como a alta condutividade e mobilidade eletrnica. O RGO/Au sero depositados sobre substratos de rgidos e flexveis por eletroforese. O desempenho dos filmes biossensores para deteco de doenas como, por exemplo, a Hepatite C, ser avaliada, quanto sensibilidade, seletividade, estabilidade e repetibilidade atravs de medidas eltricas como voltametria cclica e impedncia.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

ORIENTACAO.TITULO-ORIENTACAO: Preparao e Caracterizao de xido de grafeno para aplicao como biosensor.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Qumica de Araraquara - UNESP

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de Nanoestruturas e Filmes de ZnO para Aplicao em Sensores e Nanogeradores
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A presente proposta objetiva estudar nanoestruturas e filmes finos de xido semicondutores crescidos via sntese hidrotrmica assistida por microondas e depositados em diferentes tipos de substratos visando aplicaes de grande interesse tecnolgico como biosensores, sensores de gases, e nanogeradores. Os materiais sintetizados tero suas propriedades estruturais e morfolgicas caracterizadas por microscopia de fora atmica (AFM), microscopia eletrnica de varredura (SEM), difrao de raios-X (XRD) e microscopia eletrnica de transmisso. O material utilizado ser o xido de zinco (ZnO) devido s propriedades funcionais desse xido, alm de ser biocompatvel. Filmes das nanoestruturas sero crescidos diretamente sobre substratos de vidro, diamante e langasite, durante o processo de sntese ou sero sintetizados e depositados posteriormente atravs de spin coating. O desempenho dos filmes sensores (sensibilidade, velocidade de resposta, seletividade, estabilidade) sero avaliados quanto sensitividade, biocompatividade, capacidade de converso (parmetros piezoeletricos).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Desenvolvimento de Nanoestruturas e Filmes de ZnO para Aplicao em Sensores e Nanogeradores

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

ORIENTACAO.TITULO-ORIENTACAO: Preparao e caracterizao de filmes finos e nanoestruturas de ZnO

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Especialista de Laboratrio Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento na rea de E&EBG (Electronic & Energy BusinessGroup). Responsvel por desenvolvimento de novas tecnologias e produtos para o mercado eletro eletrnico. Com foco em desenvolvimento de fitas eltricas isolantes como por exemplo PVC, fitas de polister, fitas de tecido de vidro e tecido de acetato para motores e geradores de energia, bem como desenvolvimento de mastique (massa de vedao) para o mercado de linha branca. Durante o perodo de trabalho foram desenvolvidos em torno de seis invenes de novos produtos que foram submetidos a avaliao do comite da 3M nos USA para deposio de patente, sendo que um deles foi concedida a submisso e depsito da patente no INPI.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Graphene oxide and gold nanoparticles for advanced biosensors.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Recent advances in interdisciplinary research in molecular diagnostics have a quickly development of different classes of biosensors with increasingly better sensor characteristics. In addition, the development in engineering and nanotechnology areas has been of fundamental importance for miniaturization and technological multifunctionality of biosensors. Molecular diagnosis facilitates the primary detection of diseases with greater specificity and sensitivity, but they require time and are costly. Biosensors have emerged as a cheap, easy-to-handle, portable alternative with high sensitivity and specificity. Graphene is a two-dimensional nanomaterial with a thick carbon atom, the carbon atoms has sp2 hybridized and packaged in a crystalline lattice. Recently graphene has received special attention as an emerging material because of the potential applications due to their electrical, mechanical, optical and biological properties. Cancer is a public health problem, especially among developing countries, where it is expected that in the coming decades, the impact of cancer on the population will account for 80% of the estimated 20 million new cases by 2025. The estimate for Brazil, biennium 2016-2017, indicates the occurrence of about 600 thousand new cases of cancer. The graphene with Au and Ag nanoparticles has been explored because of the Raman enhanced signal of the adsorbates. To obtained this material we were operate by 1) depositing single graphene monolayer by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) and then coupling it to a metallic nanoparticle-based substrate and 2) by synthesizing 3D structures by hydrothermal synthesis composed by graphene and metallic nanoparticles The higher quality surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) substrates have been used to investigated the hybrid structures of graphene and metal nanoparticles. Compared with SERS substrates, which only contain metal NPs, the additional graphene layer provides structural, chemical, and optical advantages.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Recent advances in interdisciplinary research in molecular diagnostics have a quickly development of different classes of biosensors with increasingly better sensor characteristics. In addition, the development in engineering and nanotechnology areas has been of fundamental importance for miniaturization and technological multifunctionality of biosensors. Molecular diagnosis facilitates the primary detection of diseases with greater specificity and sensitivity, but they require time and are costly. Biosensors have emerged as a cheap, easy-to-handle, portable alternative with high sensitivity and specificity. Graphene is a two-dimensional nanomaterial with a thick carbon atom, the carbon atoms has sp2 hybridized and packaged in a crystalline lattice. Recently graphene has received special attention as an emerging material because of the potential applications due to their electrical, mechanical, optical and biological properties. Cancer is a public health problem, especially among developing countries, where it is expected that in the coming decades, the impact of cancer on the population will account for 80% of the estimated 20 million new cases by 2025. The estimate for Brazil, biennium 2016-2017, indicates the occurrence of about 600 thousand new cases of cancer. The graphene with Au and Ag nanoparticles has been explored because of the Raman enhanced signal of the adsorbates. To obtained this material we were operate by 1) depositing single graphene monolayer by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) and then coupling it to a metallic nanoparticle-based substrate and 2) by synthesizing 3D structures by hydrothermal synthesis composed by graphene and metallic nanoparticles The higher quality surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) substrates have been used to investigated the hybrid structures of graphene and metal nanoparticles. Compared with SERS substrates, which only contain metal NPs, the additional graphene layer provides structural, chemical, and optical advantages.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Graphene oxide and gold nanoparticles for advanced biosensors.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Graphenic Aerogels Decorated with Ag Nanoparticles as 3D SERS Substrates for Biosensing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Graphenic aerogels decorated with Ag nanoparticles as 3D SERS substrates for biosensing

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A versatile and efficient Surface-Enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) substrate based on a hybrid aerogel composed of reduced graphene oxide (rGO) decorated with silver nanoparticles (AgNPs), suitable for highly sensitive label-free detection of chemical and biological species, is here presented and discussed. The simple and low-cost onepot hydrothermal synthesis allows obtaining a 3D nanostructured spongy-like matrix that shows a good spatial distribution of Ag nanoparticles in intimate contact with rGO flakes, that was characterized by means of several techniques such as FESEM, TEM, XRD BET and XPS. The nanostructured material, tested by SERS analysis with both Rhodamine 6G (R6G) and 4-Mercaptobenzoic Acid (MBA) showed a satisfying SERS efficiency, quantified in terms of minimum detectable concentration of 10-10 M and 10- 7M, corresponding to on- and off-resonant excitation, respectively. The versatility of chemical and biochemical functionalization was successfully demonstrated by exploiting different routes by immobilizing both protoporphyrinIX (PRPIX) and hemin (H) that take advantage of π-π non-covalent bonding with the graphene layers and thiol-ended oligonucleotides (DNA probes/aptamers) directly grafted on the AgNPs. Finally, after the successful integration of the hybrid aerogel into a microfluidic chip, the biorecognition of miR222 was obtained demonstrating the reliability of the aerogel substrate as SERS platform for biosensing.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A versatile and efficient Surface-Enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) substrate based on a hybrid aerogel composed of reduced graphene oxide (rGO) decorated with silver nanoparticles (AgNPs), suitable for highly sensitive label-free detection of chemical and biological species, is here presented and discussed. The simple and low-cost onepot hydrothermal synthesis allows obtaining a 3D nanostructured spongy-like matrix that shows a good spatial distribution of Ag nanoparticles in intimate contact with rGO flakes, that was characterized by means of several techniques such as FESEM, TEM, XRD BET and XPS. The nanostructured material, tested by SERS analysis with both Rhodamine 6G (R6G) and 4-Mercaptobenzoic Acid (MBA) showed a satisfying SERS efficiency, quantified in terms of minimum detectable concentration of 10-10 M and 10- 7M, corresponding to on- and off-resonant excitation, respectively. The versatility of chemical and biochemical functionalization was successfully demonstrated by exploiting different routes by immobilizing both protoporphyrinIX (PRPIX) and hemin (H) that take advantage of π-π non-covalent bonding with the graphene layers and thiol-ended oligonucleotides (DNA probes/aptamers) directly grafted on the AgNPs. Finally, after the successful integration of the hybrid aerogel into a microfluidic chip, the biorecognition of miR222 was obtained demonstrating the reliability of the aerogel substrate as SERS platform for biosensing.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Recent Advances in Complex Functional Materials

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Methods for design and fabrication of nanosensors: the case of ZnO-based nanosensor

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Advanced materials research currently focuses on the design and fabrication of nanosensors and shows tremendous potential for the development of numerous applications in various areas of nanotechnology. The significant scientific and technological advances in materials design for nanosensor applications have wide-ranging economic implications. From a practical point of view, nanosensors are classified as either chemical or physical and usually comprise at least one nanoscale component. New technologies based on advanced nanoscale materials have considerable advantages over more traditional sensors. Nanosensors are typically very sensitive and can detect variations in concentrations of many types of target particles, including single viruses, proteins, and molecules in diverse and complex environments. Nanosensor fabrication is highly challenging, but there have been significant advances in research and development, particularly in terms of customizing fabrication methods for specific applications. There are many kinds of nanosensors and correspondingly many ways to manufacture them. Yet, the ability to create new nanoscale complex materials and devices in different desired configurations depends mainly on developing new approaches to materials synthesis. Here our emphasis that is motivated on highlighting the defect engineering may provide essential clues to improve our synthesis methods and understanding of their outstanding properties at the nanoscale. This chapter summarizes some examples of the design and fabrication of nanosensors based on ZnO nanocrystals, potentially serving a diverse range of applications, as described in detail. It also discusses the fundamental concepts behind the design and fabrication of these nanosensors in view of their many applications.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: University of Florence, Via Gino Capponi 9

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Graphenic aerogel decorated by Ag nanoparticles: a promising 3D nanostructure for SERS biosensing

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Centro de Convenes de Bonito, MS,

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Surface-enhanced Raman Scattering (SERS) is increasingly applied to the sensitive label-free detection of biomolecules. This scenario thrived in the last decade due to innovative nanostructured materials based on semiconductors, metal-oxides or graphene decorated by noble metal nanoparticles [1]. Indeed, the obtained plasmonic nanostructures are featured by Localized Surface Plasmon Resonances that are exploited to amplify the Raman scattering of the analytes, thus reaching the very high sensitivity usually required for biomarkers detection. A great research effort has been made to fabricate noble metal (Ag or Au) nanostructures incorporating as much as possible Raman hot spots yielding a huge electromagnetic (EM) field enhancement thanks to the excitation of localized surface plasmons at resonance conditions (LSPR). Moreover, taking advantage of the discovery in 2010 of the graphene-enhanced Raman scattering (GERS), graphene-based structures are of great interest for Raman-enhanced (bio) sensing due to the chemical enhancement effect attributed to a charge-transfer (CT) process in synergy with the EM mechanism [2]. The reduced Graphene Oxide (rGO) can be a suitable and low-cost graphene based-material that can be assembled in 3-D networks and allows to exploit different routes of chemical and biochemical functionalization (physisorption or chemisorption). It can take advantage from the presence of the residual oxygen atoms or the possibility to establish???? non-covalent bonding with the graphene layers. In this work, we report on the synthesis and characterization of a hybrid [1] aerogel based on reduced rGO decorated with silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) exploitable for the SERS detection of biomolecules at very low concentration. In this work, SERS substrates based on plasmonic nanostructures such as 3-D graphene-Ag based aerogels nanostructures on polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) membranes is presented for biosensing applications.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Surface-enhanced Raman Scattering (SERS) is increasingly applied to the sensitive label-free detection of biomolecules. This scenario thrived in the last decade due to innovative nanostructured materials based on semiconductors, metal-oxides or graphene decorated by noble metal nanoparticles [1]. Indeed, the obtained plasmonic nanostructures are featured by Localized Surface Plasmon Resonances that are exploited to amplify the Raman scattering of the analytes, thus reaching the very high sensitivity usually required for biomarkers detection. A great research effort has been made to fabricate noble metal (Ag or Au) nanostructures incorporating as much as possible Raman hot spots yielding a huge electromagnetic (EM) field enhancement thanks to the excitation of localized surface plasmons at resonance conditions (LSPR). Moreover, taking advantage of the discovery in 2010 of the graphene-enhanced Raman scattering (GERS), graphene-based structures are of great interest for Raman-enhanced (bio) sensing due to the chemical enhancement effect attributed to a charge-transfer (CT) process in synergy with the EM mechanism [2]. The reduced Graphene Oxide (rGO) can be a suitable and low-cost graphene based-material that can be assembled in 3-D networks and allows to exploit different routes of chemical and biochemical functionalization (physisorption or chemisorption). It can take advantage from the presence of the residual oxygen atoms or the possibility to establish???? non-covalent bonding with the graphene layers. In this work, we report on the synthesis and characterization of a hybrid [1] aerogel based on reduced rGO decorated with silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) exploitable for the SERS detection of biomolecules at very low concentration. In this work, SERS substrates based on plasmonic nanostructures such as 3-D graphene-Ag based aerogels nanostructures on polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) membranes is presented for biosensing applications.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Plasmonic graphene-based 3D nanostructures for highly sensitive biosensing platforms
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Plasmonic graphene-based 3D nanostructures for highly sensitive biosensing platforms

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Hynes Convention Center - Boston - Massachusets - USA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Surface-enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) spectroscopy attracted much attention for the highly sensitive label-free detection of chemical and biological species. A great research effort has been made to fabricate noble metal (Ag or Au) nanostructures incorporating as much as possible Raman hot spots yielding a huge electromagnetic (EM) field enhancement thanks to the excitation of localized surface plasmons at resonance conditions (LSPR). Moreover, taking advantage of the discovery in 2010 of the graphene-enhanced Raman scattering (GERS), graphene based structures are of great interest for Raman-enhanced (bio) sensing due to the chemical enhancement effect attributed to a charge-transfer (CT) process in synergy with the EM mechanism. The reduced Graphene Oxide (rGO) can be a suitable and low-cost graphene based-material that can be assembled in 3-D networks and allows to exploit different routes of chemical and biochemical functionalization (physisorption or chemisorption). It can take advantage from the presence of the residual oxygen atoms or the possibility to establish − non-covalent bonding with the graphene layers. In this work, we report on the synthesis and characterization of a hybrid aerogel based on reduced rGO decorated with silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) exploitable for the SERS detection of biomolecules at very low concentration. Several synthesis conditions were approached by exploiting a one-pot hydrothermal process, starting from commercial GO and adding either AgNO3 as silver precursor with different additives (such as trisodium citrate) or directly a pre-synthesized Ag colloid. The resulting 3-D porous sponge-like nanoarchitecture provides both a high surface area and a homogeneous spatial distribution of AgNPs arranged in order to maximize the Raman hot spots density and thus allowing to concentrate and adsorb biomolecules from highly diluted solutions. By decorating rGO with AgNPs, the synergy of the EM fi

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A pesquisadora Glenda Biasotto, ps ? doutoranda na Universidade Estadual Paulista (Unesp) Araraquara e integrante do Centro de Desenvolvimento de Materiais Funcionais (CDMF), sob superviso de Maria Aparecida Zaghete, professora do Instituto de Qumica de Araraquara (IQAr) da Unesp e coordenadora de pesquisa do CDMF, fala sobre os estudos que desenvolve na rea de funcionalizao biossensores para utilizao em testes diagnsticos.
Em trabalhos recentes, a pesquisadora integrou dispositivos sensores com aerogis de grafeno com nanopartculas de ouro e com nanopartculas de prata, sintetizados em parceria com a Universidade de Turim.
Os biossensores obtidos apresentaram alta sensibilidade para deteco de molculas de RNA, indicando um grande potencial para sua utilizao em testes diagnsticos para o vrus SARS-CoV-2, responsvel pela pandemia de COVID ? 19.
A pesquisador fala mais detalhadamente sobre as pesquisas no vdeo a seguir.
